title: NDTV News-World-news
description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

entries.title: Canadian Police Bust Migrant Smuggling Ring Sneaking People Into US
entries.description: Canadian police announced Thursday the dismantling of a vast migrant smuggling network accused of sneaking hundreds of people from Canada into the United States.

entries.title: UK Doctor Who Popularised Intermittent Fasting Goes Missing On Greek Island
entries.description: The doctor is credited for the rising popularity of the 5:2 diet for losing weight, which involves fasting for two days per week.

entries.title: Man Behind Dress ''That Broke The Internet'' Jailed For Strangling His Wife
entries.description: The attack came seven years after the couple gained worldwide fame for the dress the mother of the bride wore at their wedding.

entries.title: Second Japanese Town To Build Fence Around Bridge To Block Mount Fuji View
entries.description: The scenic bridge in Shizuoka prefecture aligns directly with the outline of Mount Fuji and has become a social media hotspot in recent months.

entries.title: UN Warns Of "Devastating" Conflict Along Israel-Lebanon Border
entries.description: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres called Thursday for an end to hostilities along the demarcation line between Lebanon and Israel, warning of the risk of a broader conflict.

entries.title: UK Woman Says She Inspired 'Baby Reindeer', Sues Netflix For $170 Million
entries.description: A British woman who claims she was the inspiration for the stalker in the smash Netflix hit "Baby Reindeer" sued the streamer Thursday, demanding $170 million in damages.

entries.title: Watch: Indian-Origin Sunita Williams Dances On Her Arrival At Space Station
entries.description: The Boeing Starliner with Indian-origin astronaut Sunita Williams and her crewmate Butch Wilmore on Thursday safely docked with the International Space Station (ISS).

entries.title: Dramatic Footage Of SpaceX Rocket's Historic Splashdown In Gulf Of Mexico
entries.description: SpaceX's massive Starship rocket achieved its first ever splashdown during a test flight Thursday, in a major milestone for the prototype system that may one day send humans to Mars.

entries.title: Yemen's Houthis Claim They Attacked Ships At Haifa Port, Israel Denies
entries.description: Yemen's Houthi group on Thursday said that they had launched joint aerial attacks with an Iraqi group, targeting ships in Israel's port of Haifa, though the Israeli military denied the claim.

entries.title: Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu To Address US Congress On July 24: Report
entries.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will address lawmakers in the US Congress on July 24, Republican party leaders announced Thursday.

entries.title: Boeing Starliner Crew Aboard Space Station After Challenging Docking
entries.description: A Boeing Starliner capsule carrying its first ever astronauts docked with the International Space Station on Thursday after overcoming unexpected challenges arising from thruster malfunctions and helium leaks.

entries.title: Trump Suggests Tariffs Against Nations Over Illegal Immigration
entries.description: Republican former U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he may impose tariffs on countries, including China, that do not curb the flow of undocumented immigrants from their territory to the United States, if he wins the election in November.

entries.title: Won't Pardon Son Hunter Biden If Convicted In Gun Trial, Says US President
entries.description: US President Joe Biden has said that he would not pardon his son, Hunter Biden, if he is found guilty of criminal federal gun charges, reported CNN.

entries.title: Saudi Arabia Says Hajj Pilgrimage To Start June 14
entries.description: Saudi Arabia said the hajj will start on June 14 after astronomical observatories spotted the crescent moon Thursday evening, signalling the beginning of the month in which the annual pilgrimage falls.

entries.title: Hamas Has Not Responded To Latest Ceasefire Proposal: Qatar
entries.description: Qatari foreign ministry spokesperson Majed Al-Ansari said that Hamas has not yet handed mediators its response to the latest ceasefire proposal and is still studying it, adding that Qatari, Egyptian and the U.S. mediators are still making efforts.

entries.title: "Taiwan Is An Inalienable Part Of China": Chinese Embassy In India
entries.description: The Chinese Embassy in India on Thursday reiterated that Taiwan is an "inalienable part" of the territory of China.

entries.title: Israel Bombed Gaza School "Without Prior Warning": UN Agency
entries.description: The head of the UN's Palestinian refugee agency, Philippe Lazzarini, said Thursday that Israel had bombed one of its Gaza schools "without prior warning" to thousands of displaced sheltering there.

entries.title: "Greatest Generation Ever": WWII Veterans Shine On D-Day
entries.description: Around 180 veterans in their late 90s or even over 100 were guests of honour at D-Day commemorations in France on Thursday, many attending in wheelchairs for possibly the last time.

entries.title: Joe Biden Vows Ukraine Will Not Use US Weapons To Strike Russia
entries.description: President Joe Biden insisted Thursday that US weapons would not be used to attack Moscow after he authorized Ukraine to strike targets inside Russia with Western-supplied arms.

entries.title: France Court Considers Restoring "Honour" To Man Guillotined in 1957
entries.description: France's highest appeals court on Thursday examined a man's unprecedented request to have his father's "honour" restored following his 1957 execution by guillotine for killing a policeman in an armed robbery.
